files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Application
files.Summary:
Represents an abstract base class for Xui applications. This class is paired at runtime with a platform-specific counterpart, which delegates to actual system APIs on macOS, Windows, Android, etc.

Users should subclass , override the method, and call to launch the application.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.DeleteBackwardsEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event requesting deletion of content positioned logically before the caret or selection range. Typically triggered by a "Backspace" key press or an equivalent gesture.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.FrameEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level event dispatched once per frame, providing timing information used for driving animations and visual updates.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.InsertTextEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event requesting insertion of text at the current caret or selection position.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.MouseButton
files.Summary: Identifies a specific mouse button involved in a pointer event.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.MouseDownEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event indicating that a mouse button was pressed at a given position.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.MouseMoveEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event indicating that the mouse pointer has moved to a new position.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.MouseUpEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event indicating that a mouse button was released at a given position.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.RenderEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level render event dispatched after a timing frame, indicating that views should perform layout and rendering operations within a given region.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.ScrollWheelEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event generated by a scroll wheel or trackpad gesture, indicating a change in scroll position.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.Touch
files.Summary: Represents a single touch point within a multi-touch input event.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.TouchEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level input event containing one or more touch points, typically originating from a touchscreen or trackpad gesture.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.TouchPhase
files.Summary: Describes the phase of an individual touch point during a touch event.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.WindowHitTestEventRef.WindowArea
files.Summary: Describes the purpose or function of a region within a window.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Events.WindowHitTestEventRef
files.Summary: Represents a platform-level hit test event that allows the application to define how a point within a custom window frame should be interpreted (e.g., as a draggable title bar, resize border, or transparent region).

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.HotReload
files.Summary: Internal integration point for .NET's MetadataUpdateHandler, enabling partial support for Hot Reload during development. This is not a stable API and should not be used by application developers.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.IWindow.IDesktopStyle
files.Summary: Provides optional desktop-specific window styling hints for platforms that support multiple top-level windows (e.g., Windows, macOS, Linux).

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.IWindow.ISoftKeyboard
files.Summary: Represents a handler for software keyboard input.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.IWindow
files.Summary: Defines the abstract interface for a platform window in Xui. This surface hosts rendering, input handling, and layout updates.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Abstract.Window
files.Summary: Represents an abstract cross-platform application window in Xui. Handles input, rendering, layout, and software keyboard integration.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Actual.IDispatcher
files.Summary:
Represents a platform-specific dispatcher for marshaling callbacks onto the main UI thread. Used by the Xui runtime to ensure thread-safe execution of UI logic.

Each platform must provide an implementation that posts callbacks to the appropriate runloop or UI thread.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Actual.IRunLoop
files.Summary:
Represents a platform-specific run loop responsible for driving the application's lifecycle. Each platform must provide an implementation that enters the appropriate system event loop and continues running until the application exits.

The Xui runtime uses this interface to abstract over platform differences in event dispatch and app execution.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Actual.IRuntime
files.Summary:
Provides a platform-specific implementation of the Xui runtime, responsible for creating and connecting abstract application components to their actual counterparts.

This interface acts as a bridge between the platform-independent core and the underlying OS-specific APIs (e.g., Win32, Cocoa, UIKit), enabling rendering, windowing, and event dispatch.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Actual.IWindow
files.Summary:
Represents a platform-specific window implementation used by the Xui runtime. Each platform (e.g., Windows, macOS, iOS) must provide an implementation of this interface to manage window lifecycle, rendering, and input.

This interface is typically paired with an abstract window in the Xui framework, and is not used directly by application developers.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Actual.Runtime.RuntimeNotAvailable
files.Summary: Exception thrown when is accessed before it has been initialized.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Actual.Runtime
files.Summary:
Provides global access to the platform-specific runtime environment for the current Xui application.

The platform must assign at startup with a concrete implementation, which wires up platform-specific services like rendering, window creation, and dispatching.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.ConstantDecelerationCurve
files.Summary: Represents a 1D motion curve with constant deceleration (e.g., for scroll or fling). Starts at a given position and velocity, then decelerates linearly to a stop.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.CubicMotionCurve
files.Summary: Represents a 1D cubic motion curve over time, interpolating both position and velocity. Time is expressed using , and calculations are performed in seconds.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.Easing.CubicBezier
files.Summary: Represents a CSS-style cubic Bézier easing curve constrained between (0,0) and (1,1).

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.Easing.PolynomialEasing
files.Summary: Represents a 3rd- or 4th-degree polynomial easing function for animation timing curves.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.Easing
files.Summary: Provides a collection of easing functions and smoothing utilities used in animations. All easing methods are normalized to take a parameter t in the range [0, 1].

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.ExponentialDecayCurve
files.Summary: Represents a motion curve where velocity decays exponentially over time. Commonly used to simulate fling or momentum-based motion with smooth slowdown.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Animation.QuadraticMotionCurve
files.Summary:
Represents a 1D motion curve under constant acceleration, defined as a quadratic function of time.

This curve is useful for modeling motion that decelerates smoothly to a stop, such as fling or scroll-stop animations.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.Color
files.Summary: Represents a color using red, green, blue, and alpha components, all normalized to the range [0, 1].

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.Colors
files.Summary: Provides web standard named color constants in 32-bit RGBA format (0xRRGGBBAA). These match the named colors from the CSS color specification: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/named-color

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.CornerRadius
files.Summary: Represents the radius of each corner of a rectangle, allowing for uniform or non-uniform rounding.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.FillRule
files.Summary: Specifies the algorithm used to determine the "insideness" of a point in a path, controlling how filled shapes are rendered.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.Font
files.Summary: Describes a font used for text layout and rendering, similar to the CSS font model.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.FontStyle
files.Summary:
Represents a web-like font style, supporting normal, italic, and oblique variations. Global CSS styles like inherit, unset, and initial are not supported.

Reference: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-style

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.GradientStop
files.Summary: Represents a single color stop in a gradient, defined by an offset and a color. Used for both linear and radial gradients.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.IContext
files.Summary: Represents a 2D drawing context for the Xui Canvas, modeled after the HTML5 Canvas 2D context API. This interface aggregates all sub-contexts responsible for different aspects of 2D rendering, including state, drawing primitives, text, images, transformations, and resource management.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.IImageDrawingContext
files.Summary:
Defines methods for drawing image-like content onto the canvas, such as bitmaps, video frames, or decoded image buffers.

Mirrors the image drawing APIs from the HTML5 Canvas 2D context. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/drawImage

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.IPathDrawingContext
files.Summary:
Defines methods for constructing and rendering 2D paths, following the HTML5 Canvas path API model.

Reference: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D#paths

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.IPenContext
files.Summary: Defines properties and methods for controlling stroke and fill styles in a 2D drawing context, including line caps, joins, width, dashes, and brush settings for fill and stroke.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.IRectDrawingContext
files.Summary: Provides convenience methods for drawing filled and stroked rectangles, similar to the fillRect() and strokeRect() functions in the HTML5 Canvas API.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.IStateContext
files.Summary: Provides methods to save and restore the current drawing state, including styles, transforms, and clipping paths. Mirrors the behavior of the HTML5 Canvas save() and restore() methods.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.ITextDrawingContext
files.Summary: Defines methods for drawing text onto the canvas, including alignment and baseline options. Mirrors the HTML5 Canvas 2D text API for fillText(). Also provides access to text measurement via .

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.ITextMeasureContext
files.Summary: Provides functionality for measuring text and setting font properties. Mirrors the measurement behavior of the HTML5 Canvas 2D context.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.ITransformContext
files.Summary: Provides methods for manipulating the current transformation matrix of the drawing context. This includes translation, scaling, rotation, and applying affine transformations. Mirrors the transformation API of the HTML5 Canvas 2D context.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.LineCap
files.Summary: Specifies the shape used at the ends of lines when stroking paths. Mirrors the lineCap property in the HTML5 Canvas API.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.LineJoin
files.Summary: Specifies how two connected lines are joined when stroking a path. Mirrors the lineJoin property in the HTML5 Canvas API.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.LinearGradient
files.Summary: Represents a linear gradient brush that transitions between colors along a straight line, following the same behavior as the HTML5 Canvas createLinearGradient().

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.PaintStyle
files.Summary: Specifies the type of brush or fill style used for painting shapes or strokes. Helps distinguish between solid colors and gradient fills.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.RadialGradient
files.Summary: Represents a radial gradient brush that transitions colors outward from one circle to another, similar to createRadialGradient() in the HTML5 Canvas API.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.SVG.Extensions
files.Summary: Provides SVG-related extension methods for the interface.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.SVG.PathDataBuilder
files.Summary:
A utility for converting parsed SVG path commands into drawing operations on an target.

This builder supports both absolute (e.g., M, L, C) and relative (e.g., m, l, c) SVG commands, and tracks the current drawing point and control points for smooth curves.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.TextAlign
files.Summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of text relative to the drawing position. Mirrors the textAlign property in the HTML5 Canvas 2D API.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.TextBaseline
files.Summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of text relative to the drawing position. Mirrors the textBaseline property in the HTML5 Canvas 2D API.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Canvas.Winding
files.Summary: Specifies the direction in which arcs or elliptical curves are drawn, affecting fill and stroke behavior in path-based rendering.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.Bezier
files.Summary: Static helper methods for constructing Bézier curves.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.CubicBezier
files.Summary: Represents a cubic Bézier curve defined by four control points.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.CubicSpline
files.Summary: Represents a 4-point spline segment using Catmull–Rom interpolation. The curve interpolates smoothly between and .

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.ICurve
files.Summary: Represents a common interface for evaluable 2D curves.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.LinearBezier
files.Summary: Represents a linear Bézier curve, equivalent to a straight line between two points.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.LinearSpline
files.Summary: Represents a linear spline segment between two points.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.QuadraticBezier
files.Summary: Represents a quadratic Bézier curve defined by three control points.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.QuadraticSpline
files.Summary: Represents a 3-point quadratic spline segment (parabolic arc) defined by a start point, control point, and end point.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Curves2D.Spline
files.Summary: Provides factory methods for creating spline segments of various degrees.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Math2D.AffineTransform
files.Summary:
Represents a 2D affine transformation matrix in the form:

| A C Tx |
| B D Ty |
| 0 0  1 |

Used for rotating, scaling, translating, and skewing 2D vectors or points.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Math2D.Frame
files.Summary: Represents thickness values for each edge of a rectangular element.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Math2D.Point
files.Summary: Represents a point in 2D space, defined by its and coordinates.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Math2D.Rect
files.Summary: Represents a rectangle in 2D space, defined by its origin (, ) and its dimensions (, ).

files.Title: Xui.Core.Math2D.Size
files.Summary: Represents a two-dimensional size with and components.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Math2D.Vector
files.Summary: Represents a 2D vector with X and Y components, commonly used for geometric operations, layout math, and movement in 2D space.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Set.EmptySet<T>
files.Summary: Represents an empty set — a set that contains no elements.

files.Title: Xui.Core.Set.INonEnumerableSet<T>
files.Summary: Represents a mathematical set as defined by its membership test: whether an element belongs to the set.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.Direction
files.Summary: Indicates the semantic inline direction of content, such as left-to-right or right-to-left. Used to resolve text alignment, layout flow, and mirroring behavior.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.Flow
files.Summary: Controls whether layout and rendering should respect directionality and writing mode. Used to suppress mirroring and bidi-aware behavior for diagrams, graphs, and non-linguistic views.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.FlowDirection
files.Summary: Represents the resolved physical direction of layout flow along an axis. This is derived from and , and is used to control stacking, alignment, and layout flow along block or inline axes.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.HorizontalAlignment
files.Summary: Specifies how a view should be aligned horizontally within its layout bounds. Used by parent containers during layout to position the view along the inline axis.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.HorizontalStack
files.Summary:
A layout container that arranges its children horizontally from left to right.

Each child is measured with unconstrained width and a constrained height. The container expands to fit the combined width of all children.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.HorizontalUniformStack
files.Summary: A layout container that arranges its children in a horizontal stack, assigning each child the same width.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.LayoutGuide.Align
files.Summary: Defines alignment of a view within a layout axis.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.LayoutGuide.LayoutPass
files.Summary: Flags indicating which type of layout pass is being performed. Multiple passes may be combined (e.g., Measure | Render).

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.LayoutGuide.SizeTo
files.Summary: Defines how the view should interpret the size constraints during measurement.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.LayoutGuide
files.Summary: Encapsulates the parameters and results of a layout pass (Measure, Arrange, Render) for a view.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.VerticalAlignment
files.Summary: Specifies how a view should be aligned vertically within its layout bounds. Used by parent containers to control vertical positioning along the block axis.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.VerticalStack
files.Summary:
A layout container that arranges its children vertically from top to bottom.

Each child is measured with an unconstrained height and is allowed to take up as much vertical space as needed. The container expands to fit the combined height of all children.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.VerticalUniformStack
files.Summary: A layout container that arranges its children in a vertical stack, giving each child the same height.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.View
files.Summary: Base class for all UI elements in the Xui layout engine. A view participates in layout, rendering, and input hit testing, and may contain child views.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.ViewCollection
files.Summary: A base class for container views that hold and manage a list of child views. Provides methods for adding, removing, rendering, and hit testing children.

files.Title: Xui.Core.UI.WritingMode
files.Summary: Specifies the orientation and flow direction of text and block layout. Affects which axis is considered "block" and "inline".

files.Title: Xui.Middleware.Emulator.Actual.EmulatorPlatform
files.Summary:
A runtime middleware layer that intercepts platform calls to inject emulator behavior.

This class wraps a base platform implementation (e.g., Windows or macOS) and adapts it to simulate a mobile device environment for desktop testing.

files.Title: Xui.Middleware.Emulator.Actual.EmulatorWindow
files.Summary:
A middleware window that wraps a platform window to simulate a mobile device environment when running on desktop platforms like Windows or macOS.

This class implements both and , acting as a bridge between the abstract UI and the actual system window. It also implements to provide emulator-specific chrome styling and sizing.

The window draws a rounded-rectangle phone frame, overlays controls like battery and signal indicators, and translates desktop mouse events into synthetic mobile touch input.
